title: Choropleth_map_Ghana_2021_School_Attendance_Indicators
text: Create interactive map package tmap data package rGhanaCensus displays regional distribution Percentage students 3 years older dropped school. Load geometry data Ghana_2021_school_attendance_geometry rGhanaCensus package. Convert sf data frame assign new name. example, “Ghana_edu_sf” name sf data frame created. code Ghana_edu_sf |>filter(Locality=="Urban") subsets data frame retains rows survey respondents came Urban areas. Ghana_edu_sf |>filter(Locality=="Rural") can used retain observations Rural areas. Use tmap_mode("view") create interactive map. static map plotted tmap_mode("plot")

what: Map displaying Percentage of School Drop-outs from Total Respondents in each Region
title: Choropleth_map_Ghana_2021_School_Attendance_Indicators
text: code tm_facets(="Gender") specifies facets (multiple maps) Gender.
code: #Use tmap to create interactive map tmap_mode("plot") #> ℹ tmap mode set to "plot".  Ghana_edu_sf |>       dplyr::filter(Locality=="Urban") |>       tm_shape()+       tm_polygons(id="Region", col="Region",palette="YlOrRd",                   title="Percentage of School drop-outs")+       tm_text(text="Percent_Dropped_out_of_School", size=0.7)+       tm_facets(by="Gender") #>  #> ── tmap v3 code detected ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> [v3->v4] `tm_tm_polygons()`: migrate the argument(s) related to the scale of #> the visual variable `fill` namely 'palette' (rename to 'values') to fill.scale #> = tm_scale(<HERE>).[v3->v4] `tm_polygons()`: use 'fill' for the fill color of polygons/symbols #> (instead of 'col'), and 'col' for the outlines (instead of 'border.col').[v3->v4] `tm_polygons()`: migrate the argument(s) related to the legend of the #> visual variable `fill` namely 'title' to 'fill.legend = tm_legend(<HERE>)'[cols4all] color palettes: use palettes from the R package cols4all. Run #> `cols4all::c4a_gui()` to explore them. The old palette name "YlOrRd" is named #> "brewer.yl_or_rd"Multiple palettes called "yl_or_rd" found: "brewer.yl_or_rd", "matplotlib.yl_or_rd". The first one, "brewer.yl_or_rd", is returned. #> [plot mode] fit legend/component: Some legend items or map compoments do not #> fit well, and are therefore rescaled. #> ℹ Set the tmap option `component.autoscale = FALSE` to disable rescaling.

title: Choropleth_map_Ghana_2021_School_Attendance_Indicators
text: Create interactive map package tmap data package rGhanaCensus displays regional distribution population densities students 3 years older dropped school. Use tmap_mode("view") create interactive map. static map plotted tmap_mode("plot") . convert2density argument tm_polygon function calculates population density using raw count values variable Dropped_out_of_School area size case approximated shape object.
code: #Load geometry data data("Ghana_2021_school_attendance_geometry", package = "rGhanaCensus")  #Convert to sf data frame Ghana_edu_sf<- sf::st_as_sf(Ghana_2021_school_attendance_geometry)

what: Map displaying the Regional Population Density of School Drop-outs
title: Choropleth_map_Ghana_2021_School_Attendance_Indicators
code: tmap_mode("plot") #> ℹ tmap mode set to "plot".  Ghana_edu_sf |>       dplyr::filter(Locality=="Urban") |>       tm_shape()+       tm_polygons(id="Region",col="Dropped_out_of_School", palette = "RdPu",                   style="kmeans", convert2density = TRUE,                   title="Population density of School drop-outs")+        tm_text(text="Region", size=0.7)+       tm_facets(by="Gender") #>  #> ── tmap v3 code detected ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> [v3->v4] `tm_polygons()`: instead of `style = "kmeans"`, use fill.scale = #> `tm_scale_intervals()`. #> ℹ Migrate the argument(s) 'style', 'palette' (rename to 'values') to #>   'tm_scale_intervals(<HERE>)'[v3->v4] `tm_polygons()` `convert2density` is deprecated. #> ℹ Divide the variable values by the polygon areas manually (obtain the areas #>   with 'sf::st_area()').[v3->v4] `tm_polygons()`: migrate the argument(s) related to the legend of the #> visual variable `fill` namely 'title' to 'fill.legend = tm_legend(<HERE>)'[cols4all] color palettes: use palettes from the R package cols4all. Run #> `cols4all::c4a_gui()` to explore them. The old palette name "RdPu" is named #> "brewer.rd_pu"Multiple palettes called "rd_pu" found: "brewer.rd_pu", "matplotlib.rd_pu". The first one, "brewer.rd_pu", is returned.

title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation

what: 2021 Ghana Population and Housing Census Results as Data Frames
title: 2021 Ghana Population and Housing Census Results as Data Frames
text: 2021 Ghana Population Housing Census Results Data Frames package contains 2021 Ghana Population Housing Census Results. Users can access results ‘tidyverse’ ‘sf’-Ready Data Frames. Data available package 13th January, 2022 School attendance indicators respondents aged 3 years older plus Ghana regional administrative boundaries. Variables corresponding derived percentage columns School attendance data scraped Ghana Statistical Service website. Url:https://statsghana.gov.gh/ Source: 2021 Ghana Population Housing Census Results Volume 3D Literacy Education PDF Reports published 16th December, 2021. Ghana regional administrative boundaries geometry data downloaded Humanitarian data exchange website 7th January, 2022} Url:https://data.humdata.org/dataset/ghana-administrative-boundaries Special thanks Shelmith Kariuki (Author rKenyaCensus) Kyle Walker (Author tidycensus) inspiration.

what: Ghana School Attendance Indicator data — Ghana_2021_school_attendance
title: Ghana School Attendance Indicator data — Ghana_2021_school_attendance
text: Ghana_2021_school_attendance dataset contains school attendance indicators respondents 16 regions Ghana surveyed 2021 Ghana Population Housing Census. age range survey respondents data set 3 years .

title: Ghana School Attendance Indicator data — Ghana_2021_school_attendance
Ghana School Attendance Indicator data — Ghana_2021_school_attendance
text: data frame 64 rows 10 variables: Region factor 16 levels names regions Ghana Gender factor 2 levels Locality factor 2 levels describing respondents surveyed lived urban rural area Currently_Attending_School numeric column raw count values survey respondents aged 3 years currently attending school Percent_Currently_Attending_School numeric column derived percentage ((Currently_Attending_School)/Sum_of_Respondents_(3_years_and_above))*100 two decimal places Never_Attended_School -numeric column raw count values survey respondents aged 3 years never attended school Percent_Never_Attended_School numeric column derived percentage ((Never_Attended_School)/Sum_of_Respondents_(3_years_and_above))*100 two decimal places Dropped_out_of_School numeric column raw count values survey respondents aged 3 years school dropped Percent_Dropped_out_of_School numeric column derived percentage ((Dropped_out_of_School)/Sum_of_Respondents_(3_years_and_above))*100 two decimal places Sum_of_Respondents_(3_years_and_above) numeric column raw sum values row. sum (Currently_Attending_School, Never_Attended_School, Dropped_out_of_School) row

title: Ghana School Attendance Indicator data — Ghana_2021_school_attendance
text: School attendance data Scraped Ghana Statistical Service published 2021 Ghana Population Housing Census Results Volume 3D Literacy Education PDF Reports https://statsghana.gov.gh/gssmain/fileUpload/pressrelease/2021%20PHC%20General%20Report%20Vol%203D_Literacy%20and%20Education.pdf Ghana regional administrative boundaries geometry data Downloaded Humanitarian data exchange website 7th January, 2022 https://data.humdata.org/dataset/ghana-administrative-boundaries

title: Ghana School Attendance Indicator data plus geometry — Ghana_2021_school_attendance_geometry
code: #Example  #Create a interactive map with the package tmap that displays the #regional distribution of percentage of students 3 years or older who have dropped out of school.  #Load required packages library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.12.1, GDAL 3.8.4, PROJ 9.4.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE library(tmap) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(magrittr)  #Load geometry data data("Ghana_2021_school_attendance_geometry", package = "rGhanaCensus")   #Convert to sf data frame and assign a name #In this example, "Ghana_edu_sf" will be the name of the sf data frame created.  Ghana_edu_sf<- sf::st_as_sf(Ghana_2021_school_attendance_geometry)  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ #Use tmap to create interactive map tmap_mode("plot")  Ghana_edu_sf %>%                dplyr::filter(Locality=="Urban") %>%                tm_shape()+                tm_polygons(id="Region", col="Percent_Dropped_out_of_School")+                tm_text(text="Percent_Dropped_out_of_School")+                tm_facets(by="Gender") } # }
